resources.string: Extremely weak
Very weak
Not so strong
Strong
Super strong
Let’s make this password stronger.
Good, but we can make it stronger.
It’s just short of great.
Now that’s a strong password!
Ultimate password strength reached!
Nice start
Keep it up
Good progress
Loving this
Boom! Now that’s strong
Your password is not strong enough
Using straight rows of keys like ¨\"QWERTY\" makes your password weak.
Using short keyboard patterns like \"QWERFV\" makes your password weak.
Using letter patterns like \"tujtujtuj\" makes your password weak.
Repeating the same letter like \"gggg\" makes your password weak.
Using sequences like \"abc\" and \"6543\" makes your password weak.
Using recent years makes your password weak.
Using dates makes your password weak.
This is one of the 10 most common passwords.
This is one of the 100 most common passwords.
This is a very common password.
This is similar to a common password.
Using only one word makes your password weak.
Using only a name makes your password weak.
Using popular names or last names makes your password weak.
Use multiple words and avoid common phrases like \"atthebeach.\"
Symbols, single digits, and uppercase letters do not make your password strong.
Add another word or two. Uncommon words make your password strong.
Use a longer and more complex keyboard pattern.
Repeating words and letters makes your password weak.
Avoid sequences like \"abc\" and \"6543.\"
Avoid years of birth.
Avoid years that are important to you.
Avoid dates and years that are important to you.
Capitalizing letters does not make your password strong.
Capitalizing letters does not make your password strong.
Words typed backwards like \"drowssaP\" do not make your password strong.
Using substitutions like \"@\" instead of \"a\" does not make your password strong.
